description: President Donald Trump on Thursday signed an executive order targeting WilmerHale, marking the latest expansion of the president’s campaign against law firms tied to his political enemies or investigations into his actions.
title: Trump Signs Executive Order Against Law Firm WilmerHale on Mueller Ties

description: Elon Musk, the billionaire running President Donald Trump’s federal cost cutting effort, said he plans to slash $1 trillion in government spending by the end of May.
title: Elon Musk Says DOGE Aims to Finish $1 Trillion in Cuts by End of May

description: The head of the global organization responsible for vaccinating children in the world’s poorest countries is headed to Washington, hoping to persuade the Trump administration to reverse a surprise decision to halt all US funding — a move that has blindsided the group and threatens millions of lives.
title: Blindsided by Trump, Vaccine Chief Fights to Reverse Funding Cut

description: Anthony Albanese is at risk of being the first Australian leader in almost a century to lose power after just one term, with polls showing voters are increasingly frustrated with his center-left government.
title: China Ties, Renewables Push: What’s at Stake in Australia Election

description: New applications for unemployment benefits filed by federal employees declined for a fourth week and are now back to levels seen at the end of 2024.
title: Jobless Claims by US Federal Workers Fall Back to End-2024 Level

description: US lawmakers are renewing efforts to scrutinize foreign funding at American colleges, warning of the risk that countries such as China are using academic partnerships to potentially access sensitive research on artificial intelligence and other advanced technologies.
title: Colleges Face Renewed US Bid to Scrutinize China, Russia Funding

description: Australia’s Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has called an election for May 3, kicking off what’s expected to be a closely-fought campaign centered on cost-of-living pressures and a housing crisis in a sluggish economy.
title: Australia PM Calls Election for May 3 as Polls Show Tight Race

description: A federal judge on Thursday ordered US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth and other top Trump administration officials to preserve all Signal app communications from a five-day period earlier this month in a civil suit over the government’s ongoing group chat controversy.
title: US Agencies Ordered by Judge to Preserve Recent Signal Chats

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Detroit bureau chief David Welch looks at the impact of the new auto tariffs on the market for affordable cars. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Tariffs Further Dim Dreams of an Affordable Car

description: President Donald Trump and top administration officials are facing a firestorm of criticism after the editor of the Atlantic magazine revealed that the officials had inadvertently included him in a group texting thread about a US military operation in Yemen. Much of the controversy is over why the officials were discussing highly sensitive matters on Signal, a commercial messaging app that is off-limits for US officials to exchange sensitive or classified information, despite its reputation for
title: How Trump Team’s Signal Chat Violated Security Norms

description: Donald Trump’s pick to lead the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency escaped intense questioning during his Senate nomination hearing Thursday as lawmakers instead focused their heaviest scrutiny on the president’s nominee for head of the Securities and Exchange Commission.
title: Trump’s OCC Nominee Dodges Scrutiny as Senators Focus on SEC Pick Atkins

description: The Treasury department has moved to protect a financial program for low-income and under-served communities after President Donald Trump ordered its functions be eliminated to the maximum extent legally allowed.
title: Treasury Moves to Protect Low-Income Lending Program Targeted by Trump

description: Prime Minister Mark Carney says Canada will fight back against President Donald Trump’s trade war and his tariffs on the auto sector, but he declined to outline new retaliatory moves against the US on Thursday.
title: Carney Says Nothing Off Table as Canada Plans Tariff Retaliation

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said that competition in the Arctic between various nations is growing, as US President Donald Trump seeks to annex Greenland and NATO increases its activities in the region.
title: Putin Sees Trump’s Greenland Claims as Serious in Arctic Contest

description: Greenland formed a government that excludes the island’s hardline independence group following elections shaped by Donald Trump’s intensified campaign to bring the Danish territory under US control.
title: Greenland Forms Government Amid Intensified Trump Rhetoric

description: The US Supreme Court on March 26 upheld the federal regulation of built-at-home “ghost gun” kits, backing a rule put in place during the Biden administration to stem what officials said was a torrent of untraceable weapons.
title: What Are Ghost Guns? What Did the Supreme Court Rule?

description: A Labour government pledge to devote at least 10% of its defense budget to new technologies, like drones and artificial intelligence systems, could jump start an industry that risks falling behind European peers.
title: Labour Pledges to Fix UK’s ‘Broken’ Defense Process for Startups

description: A full-blown tariff war with the US could prove a gut punch for Mexico, which is already battling an economic slowdown. Latin America’s second-biggest economy depends heavily on its commercial relationship with its northern neighbor — its top trading partner by a wide margin.
title: What Mexico Stands to Lose as Trump’s Tariffs Heat Up

description: Turkey spent the past year rebuilding its depleted foreign-exchange reserves, fortifying a financial buffer that has proven critical in navigating market turbulence.
title: Cash Arsenal Allows Erdogan to Weather His Worst Crisis in Years

description: Senate Republicans are working to change a House GOP tax plan to require fewer cuts in Medicaid health benefits for the poor and disabled, seeking to mollify members of the party worried about a public backlash.
title: Senators Seek to Modify Tax Plan to Require Fewer Medicaid Cuts

description: President Donald Trump says he will withdraw Representative Elise Stefanik’s nomination to serve as the US ambassador to the United Nations, citing Republicans’ narrow hold on the House.
title: Trump Pulls Stefanik’s UN Nomination to Protect GOP Majority

description: Without immigration, the US population would begin to shrink in 2033, undermining the nation’s economic growth, the Congressional Budget Office said on Thursday — bringing forward its estimate for that threshold by seven years.
title: US Population Set to Shrink by 2033 Without Immigration, CBO Says

description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves boasted on Wednesday that she’d restored her fiscal buffer to £9.9 billion ($13 billion) after it had been wiped out in the five months since her first budget. A day later, it’s become clear she’s lost half of it already.
title: Reeves’ UK Budgetary Buffer Already Cut in Half by Market Moves

description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio warned Venezuela that any attempt to invade Guyana or threaten Exxon Mobil Corp.’s operations in the country would be a “very bad move.”
title: Rubio Warns Venezuela Against Attacking Guyana, Exxon

description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio defended the Trump administration’s push to expel foreign citizens who have protested Israel’s military campaign in the Gaza Strip and said he may have revoked more than 300 visas so far.
title: Rubio Says US May Have Pulled Over 300 Visas, Defends Expulsions

description: An election promise by Canada’s Conservative Party that would allow individuals to avoid income taxes on some investments in domestic companies is being lauded in Toronto’s financial district.
title: Canada Conservatives’ Tax-Shelter Plan Is Potential Boon for Toronto Stocks

description: The two Democratic members of the US Federal Trade Commission fired by President Donald Trump sued to be reinstated, setting up a challenge to a 90-year-old Supreme Court case limiting the White House’s authority over independent agencies — including the Federal Reserve.
title: Trump Sued by Democratic FTC Commissioners for Their Firings

description: Turkey deported a BBC journalist, part of a widening crackdown by authorities on media and protesters following the imprisonment of Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu.
title: Turkey Deports BBC Reporter Who Covered Istanbul Mayor Protests

description: Venezuela is boosting oil exports to China to the highest in almost two years as the Trump administration deploys sanctions and secondary tariffs to squeeze the Latin American nation.
title: Flood of Venezuelan Oil Flows to China as US Raises Pressure

description: French prosecutors said that ex-President Nicolas Sarkozy should be found guilty and sent to jail for seven years over allegations his 2007 winning campaign was covertly funded by millions of euros from the late Moammar Qaddafi’s regime.
title: Prosecutors Seek Jail Term for Sarkozy in Libya Cash Trial

description: The US is pushing to control all major future infrastructure and mineral investments in Ukraine, potentially gaining a veto over any role for Kyiv’s other allies and undermining its bid for European Union membership.
title: US Seeks to Control Investment in Ukraine, Squeezing Out Europe

description: Having embraced tariffs as a central tool of both economic policy and diplomacy, US President Donald Trump has been creative with his proposals on how to deploy the import taxes. One example is his plan to impose so-called reciprocal tariffs — new duties to be customized for each trading partner with the aim of offsetting any of its practices deemed to put American exporters at a disadvantage. Another example: he’s threatened to impose what he’s calling secondary tariffs on imports from countrie
title: How Trump Plans to Use ‘Secondary Tariffs’ to Punish Importers of Venezuelan Oil

description: Now that US President Donald Trump is moving ahead with tariffs worldwide, Mexico can at least ensure its exports to the US get a lower fee than others, Economy Minister Marcelo Ebrard said.
title: Mexico Seeks ‘Preferential Treatment’ From Trump on Tariffs

description: The top two lawmakers on the Senate Armed Services Committee formally requested an inquiry into the Signal group chat where top US officials discussed impending attacks on Houthi rebels in Yemen.
title: Senators Seek Formal Review of Signal Group Chat Episode

description: Paul Atkins, President Donald Trump’s pick to lead the Securities and Exchange Commission, faced an early political test over his strong ties to Wall Street and digital-asset firms.
title: Trump Pick for SEC Faces Sharp Conflict-of-Interest Scrutiny

description: President Donald Trump’s car tariffs will take a heavy toll on Slovakia, whose $140 billion auto-dependent economy makes it among the most vulnerable European Union member states to the US trade war.
title: Trump Tariffs to Deal Blow to Slovakia’s Auto-Reliant Economy

description: Germany is getting €1 trillion ($1.1 trillion) in additional funding virtually for free after bond markets reacted positively to its “historic” spending bill, Deutsche Bank AG Chairman Alexander Wynaendts said.
title: Germany Got $1 Trillion for Free, Deutsche Bank Chairman Says

description: A coalition of European leaders rejected the possibility of easing sanctions on Russia, one of President Vladimir Putin’s demands to agree to a partial ceasefire with Ukraine.
title: European Leaders Reject Russian Demands for Sanctions Relief

description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre is promising an additional C$5,000 ($3,500) in tax-free savings room for Canadians who invest in local companies.
title: Conservatives Pitch Extra Tax-Free Savings for Canada Funds

description: Argentina’s future program with the International Monetary Fund will be for $20 billion, while executive board approval could take weeks, Economy Minister Luis Caputo said at a conference Thursday.
title: Argentina Says Its New IMF Program Will Total $20 Billion

description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. announced sweeping cuts to his department on Thursday, the latest step by the Trump administration to dramatically shrink the size of the federal government’s workforce and responsibilities.
title: RFK Jr. to Unveil Plans to Cut 10,000 Health Department Workers

description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. said Turkey will probably raise its main interest rate by mid-April, following a week of political and market turmoil sparked by the detention of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s biggest rival.
title: Goldman Sees Turkey Raising Main Interest Rate to Calm Markets

description: At least six people died when a submarine carrying tourists sank off the coast of the Egyptian Red Sea resort of Hurghada, a state-run newspaper reported.
title: Tourist Submarine Sinks off Egypt’s Red Sea Coast; Six Dead

description: The US Federal Aviation Administration said it must improve the way it identifies potentially risky air-traffic situations, following a deadly midair collision between a US Army helicopter and American Airlines Group Inc. regional jet in January.
title: FAA Says It Must Do Better After Midair Washington Collision

description: Laura Sarabia concedes she’s an unusual choice for Colombia’s top diplomat. She doesn’t come from a wealthy family, she doesn’t have much experience in international relations, and she just turned 31 years old.
title: Millennial Diplomat Serves as Petro’s Bridge to Colombia’s Elite

description: Algeria jailed a French-Algerian novelist for five years on charges of undermining national unity, in a case that’s inflamed the North African country’s already tense ties with former colonial ruler France.
title: Algeria Jails Novelist in Case That’s Inflamed Ties With France

description: US President Donald Trump’s trade war risks turning powerful influences that helped ease inflation over decades in the opposite direction.
title: Trump Risks Ending Years of Disinflation, Ex-Fed Vice Chair Says

description: Australia’s center-right opposition pledged to keep more natural gas in Australia to lower energy prices if they win the upcoming election, which is expected to be called for May 3.
title: Australia’s Opposition Pledges New Gas Reserve Ahead of Election

description: Bosnia-Herzegovina’s top court issued an international arrest notice for the country’s Serb leader, escalating a conflict with a controversial figure who has threatened to secede from the Balkan nation.
title: Bosnian Court Seeks International Arrest of Serb Leader

description: Small businesses are learning there are no safe havens in the trade wars.
title: How a US Maker of Rat-Proof Trash Bins Got Boxed in by Trump’s Tariffs

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Japan Prefers a Fickle US to Overbearing China

description: US President Donald Trump is dead set on taking control of Greenland, the world’s biggest island and a self-ruling territory of Denmark, despite opposition from Greenlanders and Danes.
title: Why Trump Is Obsessed With Taking Over Greenland

description: The UK is holding urgent talks with Donald Trump’s government in a bid to avoid being hit by extra tariffs, Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said.
title: UK in ‘Intensive’ Talks to Fend Off US Tariffs, Reeves Says

description: Austria’s economy is set to contract for a third consecutive year in a blow to plans to narrow the budget deficit that are a cornerstone of the country’s new coalition government.
title: Austria’s Enduring Recession Puts Coalition Deficit Goal at Risk

description: Some of Donald Trump’s most ardent backers are voicing frustration with his team’s refusal to admit fault over the Signal intelligence breach, a rare crack in the president’s wall of support.
title: Republicans Grow Weary of Trump Team’s Signal Chat Denials

description: Swarms of Russian drones attacked Ukraine’s major cities overnight as President Volodymyr Zelenskiy prepared to join European leaders for a meeting in Paris aimed at reinforcing Kyiv’s position in any peace settlement.
title: Russia Hits Ukraine’s Main Cities With Drones Before Paris Talks

description: Thailand is set to kickstart the process of picking a new central bank governor with the appointment of a selection panel within days, according to Finance Minister Pichai Chunhavajira.
title: Thailand Set to Start New Central Bank Chief Selection Process

description: Top trade officials from South Korea and Japan are set to meet with their Chinese counterpart in Seoul this weekend to discuss economic cooperation as they seek ways to respond to increasing trade pressure from the US, according to a media report.
title: China, Japan, South Korea to Meet as Trump Tariffs Take Shape

description: Sudan’s army recaptured the national capital from the Rapid Support Forces militia, a turning point in a two-year civil war that’s drawn in outside powers and torn the resource-rich North African country apart.
title: Sudan Army Retakes Capital From Rebels in Turning Point for War

description: Israel’s parliament passed a law early Thursday increasing the role played by politicians in selecting judges, including to the Supreme Court, drawing furious criticism from opposition leaders over what they see as a threat to democracy and unity.
title: Israel Passes Controversial Law to Influence Judge Selection

description: South Korea’s top trade official said the government will come up with steps to help the auto industry by next month, after he earlier convened an emergency meeting with business leaders to discuss the new 25% tariff on US auto imports.
title: South Korea to Unveil Emergency Measures for Automakers in April

description: President Donald Trump suggested further tariffs would be imposed on the European Union and Canada if they worked together “to do economic harm” to the US.
title: Trump Floats More Tariffs on EU, Canada If They Work Against US

description: The United Nations called for restraint and urged all parties in South Sudan to recommit to a peace accord that ended the nation’s civil war, after security forces stormed the residence of the East African nation’s deputy leader.
title: UN Calls for Calm as South Sudan Deputy Leader’s Home Is Stormed

description: Thailand’s plan to legalize casinos is headed to its parliament, putting the country a step closer to realizing a years-long proposal to attract foreign investment and boost tourism.
title: Thailand’s Casino Bill Set for Parliament in Win for Tourism

description: As Europe boosts defense spending, Israeli producers see an opportunity for arms sales—and a chance to become more self-sufficient.
title: Israel Aims to Be the World’s Arms Dealer

description: A report by the State Audit Office puts the spotlight on a foundation that invested in a Polish real estate developer and Swiss chalets.
title: Central Bank Troubles Hit Hungary at Awkward Time for Orban

description: Living next to Turkey, the country outspent larger NATO members even at the peak of its debt crisis yet its domestic defense industry lagged behind.
title: Greece Offers Vital Lessons for Europe in Defense Spending

description: The Labour government’s mixed messages about health-related welfare benefits run the risk of undermining its credibility.
title: Britain's Sick Society Won't Heal Without Trust

description: Panama is set to cancel the registration of 128 ships sailing under its flag after they were sanctioned by the US, its allies or the United Nations, a top official said.
title: Panama Registry Set to Remove 128 Ships as US Sanctions Tighten

description: A senior Chinese leader called for increased global cooperation and opposition to protectionist measures, in a thinly veiled critique aimed at the US for destabilizing trade and geopolitical relations.
title: China Vice Premier Urges Asia Leaders to Resist Protectionism

description: China has told state-owned firms to hold off on any new collaboration with businesses linked to Li Ka-shing and his family, according to people familiar with the matter, after the Hong Kong billionaire irked Beijing with his plan to sell two Panama ports to a global consortium.
title: China Pauses New Deals With Li Ka-shing Family After Panama Ports Plan

description: As Sri Lanka stabilizes after an unprecedented default in 2022, global investors will return if the country is perceived to be on the right track, according to Sweden’s Tundra Fonder AB.
title: Sri Lankan Stocks on Track to Be Frontier Haven, EM Fund Says

description: Economist Stephen Roach said China’s bet that consumers can help boost the economy may not pay off if the government fails to address the public’s broad worries about the social safety net.
title: Roach Casts Doubt on China Consumer Pivot as ‘More Slogans’

description: China’s top climate envoy said the world’s transition to clean energy will continue, even as the US’s second withdrawal from the Paris Agreement puts unprecedented stress on the fight against global warming.
title: China Envoy Sees Global Climate Fight Advancing Even Without US

description: Malaysia is moving ahead with legislation that will enable the government to tighten controls over any printed or digital publication, people familiar with the matter said, as prospects for press freedom worsen under Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim’s administration.
title: Malaysia Is Said to Push Ahead With Law Expanding Curbs on Media
